content: Are you using the account hub for setup? If so, disable it in Settings/General and use ⇶ - New Account - Email.
creator: sfhowes

content: Check out the menu option View | Layout (press Alt if the menu is hidden.) Play with the options there until it looks the way you like.
creator: rednoise

content: You must accept cookies in TB (not browser) Settings/Privacy & Security.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Try this:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General 

- scroll all the way down and click the 'Config editor' button on the right 
- click 'Accept the risk and continue' 
- search for accessibility.force_disabled > change the value to 1 > click the check mark 
- restart TB
creator: siffemoz

content: You could report it as a possible bug.
creator: siffemoz

content:
A quando risale l'ulltimo backup? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Hi, I has just reappeared, by deselecting and re-selecting View -> Toolbars -> Status Bar Xavier

content: Thunderbird è un programma che funziona localmente sul tuo PC, mi spiace ma nessuno può sistemare le cose a distanza.
creator: @next

content: If you want to receive emails on your PC and mobile and read them on both devices, you will need to use IMAP on all of your devices. POP should only be used if you only want to access your emails on a single device.
creator: bbonacci

content:
Menu > Impostazioni > Generale Sezione Centro account Togli la spunta da Crea account nel nuovo Centro account

A questo punto puoi usare la vecchia procedura automatica -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-automatica-account

o la procedura manuale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-manuale-account
creator: @next

content:
Try:

  1. Right-click trash folder → "Repair Folder" → wait for sync to complete.
  2. If "Empty Trash" option still missing: Right-click trash folder → Properties → General tab → Check "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder" → OK.

Then try right-clicking trash again - the "Empty Trash" option should reappear.
creator: jay.s1

content:
Hello, The only thing that you can do is to select the main message, close the thread and apply the tag. By doing this the whole conversation will get a tag. This would not solve you the case for new messages, but you can retag them from time to time.

Another option is described here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1192835

Bogo
